alert.note: Alert for Dundy; Hitchcock (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Goodland (Northwestern Kansas and East Central Colorado)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 05 at 9:15PM CDT by NWS Goodland
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northern Hitchcock and northeastern Dundy Counties through 845 PM MDT/945 PM CDT/... At 813 PM MDT/913 PM CDT/, Doppler radar was tracking an outflow boundary from a severe thunderstorm 9 miles northeast of Wauneta, or 10 miles west of Hayes Center, moving east at 35 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Strong winds could occur with little or no precipitation. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of northern Hitchcock and northeastern Dundy Counties. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 1100 PM MDT/midnight CDT/ for southwestern Nebraska.
